bio: John Smith is a chef with 10 years of experience. He has created 50 recipes and has gained 10000 likes for his dishes.

method: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
In a small bowl, mix together the chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt.
Cut the chicken breasts into thin strips, then coat with the spice mixture.
In a large bowl, toss the sliced peppers and onions with the olive oil.
Spread the peppers and onions in a single layer on a baking sheet, then arrange the chicken strips on top.
Roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through.
Serve with tortillas.
Cook the linguine according to package directions until al dente.
While the pasta cooks, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add the shrimp and season with salt and pepper.
Cook the shrimp for 2-3 minutes on each side, until pink and cooked through.
Add the white wine and lemon juice to the skillet and bring to a simmer.
Stir in the chopped parsley.
Serve the shrimp scampi over the cooked linguine.

recipe.recipe_name: Baked Salmon with Lemon and Dill
method: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Line a baking sheet with foil and lightly grease with olive oil.
Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper, then place them on the prepared baking sheet.
Top each fillet with a slice of lemon and a sprig of dill.
Drizzle the white wine over the salmon fillets.
Bake in the oven for 12-15 minutes, until the salmon is cooked through and flaky.
Serve hot.
